page.title: 19Trade in Dalkeith
page.content: Dalkeith enjoys a wide range of shopping facilities in keeping with a town which had an important position as a market town. The only remnant of this tradition is the weekly livestock market held in Ironmills Park on Mondays. There is also a trading standards office situated in Ironmills Park. The main shopping area of the town is in and around the High Street. Most of the major chain stores are represented including Boots, William Low, Woolworths and the Co-op. Dalkeith also has a modern shopping precinct, named Jarnac Court in commemoration of Dalkeith's twin town in France. There is also a good selection of locally owned stores situated in the town centre. Dalkeith also has a main Post Office and branch offices of the Gas and Electricity boards.
